intro: Cynoglossum tsaratananense, commonly known as the Madagascar mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, basal leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to the dry, mountainous regions of its native habitat. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
